result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Matke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 30 months
*Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 30 months
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence the defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

supervisions.notes: *Court signed an order for half-priced IID

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:35 p.m. Court calls the case and states the appearances
Cases heard today are 15CF192 and 16CF8.

Parties have received and reviewed the Pre-Sentence Investigation Record Review and have no changes.
Court has received a letter from the Defendant's mother.
Parties state they have received a copy of the letter.
Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
ADA Knaapen argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Atty Drengler argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Atty Drengler provides the Court with an order for half-priced ignition interlock device.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CF192:
6 months straight jail, concurrent with 16CF08
88 days credit

16CF8:
50 months Initial Confinement, concurrent with any sentence defendant is currently serving. 
50 Months Extended Supervision
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program & Earned Release Program after serving 30 months. 
537 days Credit 

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Do not drive without a valid license.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
$600.00 fine + costs + 26.45 blood draw.
36 month driver's license revocation 
36 month IID
Court has signed the order for half-price ignition interlock device.

Notice of Intent is provided to Atty Drengler.
Copy of Written Determinate Sentence is provided to the Defendant.
from Pre-Trial Supervision Program dated June 16, 2017
from Probation Agent in re:  will be completeing a record review in lieu of a formal PSI for cases 15CF192 and 16CF8
Sentencing hearing on June 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Brian K. Matke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF192, 15CF432, 16CF8, 15TR3476, 15TR3477
1:32 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF8 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF192 - NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF8 Count 1, 15CF192.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
The following are dismissed and read-in: 16CF8 Counts 2, 3 & 4, 15CF432, 15TR3476, 15TR3477

Court questions the defendant further re: prior convictions. 
Defendant admits this is his 9th OWI offense. 

BY THE COURT: 

Court orders PSI. 

Atty Knaapen asks to revoke the defendant's bond. 
Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 02-01-2016 10:00 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Brian K. Matke in custody. ADA David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Atty Ryan Drengler appointed
Preliminary hearing at 01-19-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Brian K. Matke appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

$7,500 cash bond: Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming with Day Reporting 14 times per week. Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess/consume controlled or synthetic substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
 If released from jail, turn in all keys to all vehicles that are titled in the Defendant's name to the Sheriff's Dept.

1:19 p.m.
DA #2015PT002378
d.o.b. 02-05-1965
DA Molepski  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepski  states facts for anticipated charges of  OWI/Restricted Susbstance 9th.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $15,000 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Defendant requests a smaller cash bond of $500.00.
